decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly getting Arclight Phoenix creatures onto the battlefield by filling the graveyard with cards and using cheap spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to trigger their return. The deck also utilizes efficient card draw spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand to dig through the deck and find key pieces, while also running disruptive spells like Spell Pierce to protect key threats. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing the power of Arclight Phoenix as its primary win condition.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from exile. By utilizing low-cost spells and card draw, the deck aims to cast multiple spells in a turn to trigger the Phoenix's ability and bring it back onto the battlefield for repeated attacks. The inclusion of Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster helps to further enable the deck's strategy by providing additional ways to fill the graveyard and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of removal and counterspells to help protect its creatures and maintain board presence.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard multiple times in a game. It uses cheap spells like Fiery Impulse and Treasure Cruise to trigger the Phoenix's ability while also controlling the board with cards like Lightning Axe and Spell Pierce. Picklock Prankster helps to enable the graveyard strategy, while Ledger Shredder helps to mill cards for Arclight Phoenix to return easily. The deck aims to pressure the opponent with a constant stream of threats while maintaining card advantage and tempo.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Lotus Field with Hidden Strings and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It also utilizes cards like Impulse and Pore Over the Pages to dig through the deck and find key pieces. Emergent Ultimatum and Dark Petition provide additional ways to search for combo pieces or powerful spells like Omniscience. The deck also includes control elements like Archdruid's Charm and Bala Ged Recovery to protect the combo and recover key cards from the graveyard.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to have a fast and aggressive start by utilizing low-cost creatures like Ornithopter and Novice Inspector, supported by powerful cards like Venerated Loxodon and Resolute Reinforcements. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck's mana base. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while also having access to removal and combat tricks like Gleeful Demolition. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan with a mix of colored sources and utility lands.

This deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence with low-cost creatures, utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to boost their power. The deck also includes protection and disruption spells like Anointed Peacekeeper and Get Lost to maintain control over the battlefield. Mutavault and Cavern of Souls provide additional versatility and consistency in playing out creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of weenies and quickly close out the game before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures and utilize burn spells to deal direct damage to the opponent or their creatures. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional resource for mana acceleration. By combining powerful artifact creatures like Smuggler's Copter and Voldaren Epicure with burn spells like Shrapnel Blast and Torch the Tower, this deck aims to take control of the game early on and apply pressure consistently.

This deck focuses on quickly getting Arclight Phoenix into the graveyard and then using spells like Opt, Consider, and Treasure Cruise to bring it back to the battlefield for repeated damage. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes a mix of different lands to ensure it has access to the necessary colors of mana to cast its spells efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and disruptive, putting pressure on the opponent while keeping them off balance.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using Lotus Field and various untap effects to cast big spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience. It also utilizes a toolbox of different cards to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The combination of powerful spells, mana acceleration, and disruption make this deck a formidable force in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It utilizes powerful creatures like Inti, Smuggler's Copter, and Kroxa to pressure the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of fast creatures, removal spells, and hand disruption to establish board control and close out the game quickly. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan while also providing flexibility in casting spells of different colors.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponents' spells, drawing cards, and clearing the board with removals. It also aims to protect itself with counterspells and board wipes while generating card advantage with card draw. The presence of Companion card Kaheera helps provide additional value and utility to the deck. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors. Key cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Shark Typhoon serve as win conditions and provide additional control options.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeated attacks. It includes cheap spells like Fiery Impulse, Lightning Axe, and Opt to trigger the Phoenix's ability, along with card draw spells like Consider, Sleight of Hand, and Treasure Cruise to help dig for more spells. The deck also includes disruption with Spell Pierce and Tempo Trespass for extra late-game power. The mana base allows for quick and consistent access to both red and blue mana sources.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying small creatures and utilizing anthem effects to pump them up and overwhelm the opponent. With a low curve and various token generators, it aims to flood the board with a mix of efficient attackers and disruptive cards like Thraben Inspector. The addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional flexibility and a strong mana base. By applying pressure early and maintaining a steady stream of threats, this deck seeks to close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively build up a board presence with small, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Favored Hoplite, and Tenth District Legionnaire. By utilizing low-cost spells like Defiant Strike and Gods Willing to protect and pump up your creatures, you can push through damage and overwhelm your opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck. Overall, the Boros Aggro archetype aims to be fast, resilient, and constantly applying pressure to your opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of control elements to disrupt the opponent while also generating value through card advantage and versatile threats. It includes a variety of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The inclusion of Lutri, the Spellchaser as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility and value to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a slower, more controlling game plan.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through the interaction between Lotus Field and other cards like Sylvan Scrying and Hidden Strings. The goal is to quickly ramp up and play powerful spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience to win the game. The deck also includes control elements like Strict Proctor and Tale's End to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With efficient card draw and search effects, the deck aims to assemble its key pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing Retraction Helix along with other cards to produce a combo that generates a large amount of mana and allows for multiple triggers of powerful abilities. Cards like Jeskai Ascendancy and Emry, Lurker of the Loch are key pieces in this combo, while Saheeli, Sublime Artificer and Mishra's Research Desk provide additional support. By constantly bouncing and replaying artifacts, the deck aims to create a loop that either mills the opponent out with Altar of the Brood or overwhelms them with a massive board state.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing counterspells, board wipes, and disruptive spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw engines like Narset, Parter of Veils and memory Deluge to maintain card advantage. The win conditions include Dream Trawler and Shark Typhoon for closing out the game. The mana base is designed to provide flexibility and consistency in casting spells, while also including utility lands like Field of Ruin and Geier Reach Sanitarium.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to utilize a variety of control spells, counterspells, and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect key threats. By efficiently managing resources and out-valuing the opponent through card advantage and tempo plays, the deck aims to establish control of the game and ultimately win through powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also includes versatile utility lands and card draw spells to ensure consistent and stable gameplay.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to maintain control of the board through cards like Supreme Verdict and shark tokens from Shark Typhoon, while generating card advantage with Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents like Omen of the Sea and The Wandering Emperor. The mana base is designed to support the deck's control game plan, providing access to a variety of utility lands and mana fixing.

The focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by using counterspells, board wipes, and card draw to outlast the opponent. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge, the deck aims to generate card advantage and create virtual card advantage with cards like Shark Typhoon and The Wandering Emperor. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in longer games. Overall, the deck looks to lock down the opponent's threats and slowly grind out a victory through card advantage and powerful finishers.
